article.headline: Jones scores 14 in second half of win
article.linkText: Cougars reach their first C-USA title game
article.story:
FORT WORTH, Texas (AP) -- Chandi Jones scored 14 of her 20 points
in the second half as (No. 12 ESPN/USA Today, No. 11 AP) Houston beat Marquette 67-59 Saturday in the semifinals of the Conference USA tournament to advance to its first conference title game in school history.

The Cougars (26-3) equaled a school record for wins in a season
and will play TCU in Sunday's championship game. TCU beat
Louisville 69-59 in the other semifinal.

Sancho Lyttle added 18 points and 12 rebounds, and Daphne Andre
scored 10 off the bench as Houston won its 11th consecutive game.

Kelly Schwerman paced Marquette (21-9) with 14 points and
Christina Quaye added 10.

Houston led 28-25 at halftime, but Jones keyed a 13-0 surge with
a basket and a 3-pointer to start the second half.

Marquette used an 18-7 run to creep within 51-46 with 8:35
remaining.

The Cougars scored the next eight points over the next three
minutes, capped by a Joann Overstreet layup, to stretch its lead to
59-46.

The Golden Eagles got no closer than six the rest of the way.

Houston has made it to the Conference USA semifinals twice in
the conference's nine-year history, with its last appearance coming
in 2002.

The Cougars can guarantee a spot in the NCAA tournament for the
third time with a win Sunday, but will most likely earn an at-large
bid if they fall short.

Marquette, who knocked off No. 24 DePaul in a quarterfinal on
Friday, jumped out to a 9-3 lead four minutes into the contest.

But the Cougars responded with a 14-2 run over the next nine
minutes, which was capped by Andre's jumper with 6:50 left in the
first half.

Houston took its biggest lead of the opening half, 28-20, on
Lyttle's turnaround jumper. The Eagles closed the gap to three on
Carolyn Kieger's jumper and Schwerman's three-pointer.
